name: cat
desc: Concatenate FILE(s), or standard input, to standard output.

flags.name: Number
flags.desc: number all output lines

flags.name: NumberNonblank
flags.desc: number nonempty output lines, overrides -n

flags.name: ShowEnds
flags.desc: display $ at end of each line

flags.name: ShowTabs
flags.desc: display TAB characters as ^I

flags.name: ShowNonprinting
flags.desc: use ^ and M- notation, except for LFD and TAB

flags.name: SqueezeBlank
flags.desc: suppress repeated empty output lines

name: tac
desc: Write each FILE to standard output, last line first. With no FILE, or when FILE is -, read standard input.

flags.name: Separator
flags.desc: use STRING as the separator instead of newline

flags.name: Before
flags.desc: attach the separator before instead of after

flags.name: Regex
flags.desc: interpret the separator as a regular expression

name: nl
desc: Write each FILE to standard output, with line numbers added.

flags.name: bodyNumbering
flags.desc:
use STYLE for numbering body lines
a      number all lines
t      number only nonempty lines
n      number no lines

flags.name: sectionDelimiter
flags.desc: use CC for separating logical pages

flags.name: footerNumbering
flags.desc:
use STYLE for numbering footer lines
a      number all lines
t      number only nonempty lines
n      number no lines

flags.name: headNumbering
flags.desc:
use STYLE for numbering header lines
a      number all lines
t      number only nonempty lines
n      number no lines

flags.name: lineIncrement
flags.desc: line number increment at each line

flags.name: joinBlankLines
flags.desc: group of NUMBER empty lines counted as one

flags.name: numberFormat
flags.desc:
insert line numbers according to FORMAT
ln     left justified, no leading zeros
rn     right justified, no leading zeros
rz     right justified, leading zeros

flags.name: noRenumber
flags.desc: do not reset line numbers at logical pagesdo not reset line numbers at logical pages

flags.name: numberSeparator
flags.desc: add STRING after (possible) line number

flags.name: startingLineNumber
flags.desc: first line number on each logical page

flags.name: numberWidth
flags.desc: use NUMBER columns for line numbers

name: od
desc:
Write an unambiguous representation, octal bytes by default, of FILE to standard output. With more than one FILE argument, concatenate them in the listed order to form the input.

If first and second call formats both apply, the second format is assumed if the last operand begins with + or (if there are 2 operands) a digit. An OFFSET operand means -j OFFSET. LABEL is the pseudo-address at first byte printed, incremented when dump is progressing. For OFFSET and LABEL, a 0x or 0X prefix indicates hexadecimal; suffixes may be . for octal and b for multiply by 512.

flags.name: addressRadix
flags.desc: output format for file offsets. RADIX is one of [doxn], for Decimal, Octal, Hex or None

flags.name: skipBytes
flags.desc: skip BYTES input bytes first

flags.name: readBytes
flags.desc: limit dump to BYTES input bytes

flags.name: strings
flags.desc: output strings of at least BYTES graphic chars. 3 is implied when BYTES is not specified

flags.name: format
flags.desc: select output format or formats

flags.name: outputDuplicates
flags.desc: do not use * to mark line suppression

flags.name: width
flags.desc: output BYTES bytes per output line. 32 is implied when BYTES is not specified

flags.name: traditional
flags.desc: accept arguments in third form above

name: base64
desc: Base64 encode or decode FILE, or standard input, to standard output.

flags.name: decode
flags.desc: decode data

flags.name: ignoreGarbage
flags.desc: when decoding, ignore non-alphabet characters

flags.name: wrap
flags.desc: wrap encoded lines after COLS character (default 76). Use 0 to disable line wrapping

name: fmt
desc: Reformat each paragraph in the FILE(s), writing to standard output.

flags.name: crownMargin
flags.desc: preserve indentation of first two lines

flags.name: prefix
flags.desc: reformat only lines beginning with STRING, reattaching the prefix to reformatted lines

flags.name: splitOnly
flags.desc: split long lines, but do not refill

flags.name: taggedParagraph
flags.desc: indentation of first line different from second

flags.name: uniformSpacing
flags.desc: one space between words, two after sentences

flags.name: width
flags.desc: maximum line width (default of 75 columns)

flags.name: goal
flags.desc: goal width (default of 93% of width)

name: fold
desc: Wrap input lines in each FILE (standard input by default), writing to standard output.

flags.name: bytes
flags.desc: count bytes rather than columns

flags.name: spaces
flags.desc: break at spaces

flags.name: width
flags.desc: use WIDTH columns instead of 80

name: head
desc: Print the first 10 lines of each FILE to standard output. With more than one FILE, precede each with a header giving the file name.

flags.name: Lines
flags.desc: print the first K lines instead of the first 10; with the leading "-", print all but the last K lines of each file

flags.name: Bytes
flags.desc: print the first K bytes of each file; with the leading "-", print all but the last K bytes of each file

name: tail
desc: Print the last 10 lines of each FILE to standard output. With more than one FILE, precede each with a header giving the file name.

flags.name: Lines
flags.desc: output the last K lines, instead of the last 10; or use -n +K to output lines starting with the Kth

flags.name: Bytes
flags.desc: output the last K bytes; alternatively, use -c +K to output bytes starting with the Kth of each file

name: sort
desc: Write sorted concatenation of all FILE(s) to standard output.

flags.name: DictionaryOrder
flags.desc: consider only blanks and alphanumeric characters

flags.name: NumericSort
flags.desc: compare according to string numerical value

flags.name: GeneralNumericSort
flags.desc: compare according to general numerical value

flags.name: HumanNumericSort
flags.desc: compare human readable numbers (e.g., 2K 1G)

flags.name: MonthSort
flags.desc: compare (unknown) < "JAN" < ... < "DEC"

flags.name: VersionSort
flags.desc: natural sort of (version) numbers within text

flags.name: RandomSort
flags.desc: sort by random hash of keys

flags.name: Reverse
flags.desc: reverse the result of comparisons

flags.name: IgnoreLeadingBlanks
flags.desc: ignore leading blanks

flags.name: IgnoreCase
flags.desc: fold lower case to upper case characters

flags.name: IgnoreNonprinting
flags.desc: consider only printable characters

flags.name: Check
flags.desc: check for sorted input; do not sort

flags.name: CheckSilent
flags.desc: like -c, but do not report first bad line

flags.name: Debug
flags.desc: annotate the part of the line used to sort, and warn about questionable usage to stderr

flags.name: Merge
flags.desc: merge already sorted files; do not sort

flags.name: Stable
flags.desc: stabilize sort by disabling last-resort comparison

flags.name: Unique
flags.desc: with -c, check for strict ordering; without -c, output only the first of an equal run

flags.name: ZeroTerminated
flags.desc: end lines with 0 byte, not newline

flags.name: FieldSeparator
flags.desc: use SEP instead of non-blank to blank transition

flags.name: Key
flags.desc: sort via a key; KEYDEF gives location and type

name: shuf
desc: Write a random permutation of the input lines to standard output.

flags.name: inputRange
flags.desc:
LO-HI
treat each number LO through HI as an input line

flags.name: headCount
flags.desc: output at most COUNT lines

flags.name: zeroTerminated
flags.desc: end lines with 0 byte, not newline

name: uniq
desc:
Filter adjacent matching lines from INPUT (or standard input), writing to OUTPUT (or standard output).
With no options, matching lines are merged to the first occurrence.

flags.name: SkipFields
flags.desc: avoid comparing the first N fields

flags.name: SkipChars
flags.desc: avoid comparing the first N characters

flags.name: CheckChars
flags.desc: compare no more than N characters in lines

flags.name: Count
flags.desc: prefix lines by the number of occurrences

flags.name: Repeated
flags.desc: only print duplicate lines

flags.name: IgnoreCase
flags.desc: ignore differences in case when comparing

flags.name: Unique
flags.desc: only print unique lines

flags.name: ZeroTerminated
flags.desc: end lines with 0 byte, not newline

flags.name: AllRepeated
flags.desc: print all duplicate lines delimit-method={none(default),prepend,separate} Delimiting is done with blank lines

name: comm
desc:
Compare sorted files FILE1 and FILE2 line by line.
With no options, produce three-column output. Column one contains lines unique to FILE1, column two contains lines unique to FILE2, and column three contains lines common to both files.

flags.name: Column1
flags.desc: suppress column 1 (lines unique to FILE1)

flags.name: Column2
flags.desc: suppress column 2 (lines unique to FILE2)

flags.name: Column3
flags.desc: suppress column 3 (lines that appear in both files)

flags.name: OutputDelimiter
flags.desc: separate columns with STR

flags.name: CheckOrder
flags.desc: check that the input is correctly sorted, even if all input lines are pairable

flags.name: NocheckOrder
flags.desc: do not check that the input is correctly sorted

name: cut
desc: Print selected parts of lines from each FILE to standard output.

flags.name: Bytes
flags.desc: select only these bytes

flags.name: Characters
flags.desc: select only these characters

flags.name: Fields
flags.desc: select only these fields;  also print any line that contains no delimiter

flags.name: Delimiter
flags.desc: use DELIM instead of TAB for field delimiter

flags.name: OnlyDelimited
flags.desc: do not print lines not containing delimiters

flags.name: OutputDelimiter
flags.desc: use STRING as the output delimiter the default is to use the input delimiter

flags.name: Complement
flags.desc: complement the set of selected bytes, characters or fields
